Because they are not having qualification, neither they are learned in the Vedic sciences, nor their behavior, their conduct, their character is up to the standard of Brahmanical prescription in the Shastra.
In the Bhagavad Gita, it is clearly said, a Brahmana is qualified in so many ways. At least nine distinct qualifications a Brahmana should have.
Shamo, Damo, Tapaha, Shoucham, Shanti, Arjavam, Evacha, Gyanam, Vigyanam, Astikyam. Nine qualifications for a Brahmana mentioned in the

Bhagavad Gita. Control of the mind, control of the senses, performing austerities, Tapasya, Shoucham, maintaining internal and external cleanliness, Shoucham, Shanti, tolerant, Arjavam is simple, is not duplicitous,

straightforward, honest in all his dealings with everyone, Arjavam, Evacha, Gyanam is having proper knowledge, Vigyanam is having proper realization of that knowledge of the Vedas, and Astikyam has got faith in the Vedic scriptures, is not simply

reciting some hymns or verses like a parrot. No, he is learned, he knows the science, he is able to apply that science in his own life, guide others how to apply that science, he knows the reality, he knows the truth, and he has got faith, he is not faithless, he is not faithless.

He is not a blind follower, he is not a foolish person who actually is ignorant but poses as a Brahmana by cheating innocent people. Not such a Brahmana. So there is an acute scarcity of qualified, learned, gentle Brahmanas.
Such Brahmanas are not there in Kali Yuga.
It is not possible, however, to revive the Vedic process of purification in this age of Kali, but there is the Pancharatrika system also recommended for this age.
See, this Varnashram.
To revive that is very difficult in Kali Yuga because there are no proper facilities and there are no good Brahmanas to revive this.
But there is another system recommended in the scriptures that is called Pancharatrika system specially for Kali Yuga.
The Pancharatrika system acts on the Shudra class of men.
Subtlety.
Supposedly the population of Kali Yuga.
So Pancharatrika is specially meant for the Shudra class of people.
Those who are born without cultural purification, without samskara, such people, they can take advantage of the Pancharatrika system.
And in this Pancharatrika system there is a prescribed purificatory process suitable for this age and the present time.
You see, this is the arrangement of the Supreme Lord Krishna for us in Kali Yuga when there is a scarcity of Brahmanas, when there is no cultural purification happening before the birth of a child.
Such a purification or purificatory process as prescribed in the Pancharatrika system is allowed only for spiritual purification.
For spiritual upliftment and not for any other purpose.
See, the purpose is also very clearly explained in the scriptures.
Why this Pancharatrika system is given when already the scriptures describe a Varanashrama Dharma system.
Why?
Because it is necessary for spiritual upliftment of the population through this Pancharatrika method.
Which is possible that anyone from any kind of background can be uplifted to the spiritual platform directly without going through the complicated procedures of the Varanashrama system.
Spiritual upliftment is never conditioned by higher or lower parentage.
See, Srila Prabhupada explained a very, very, very important point.
If somebody is born without samskara or samskruta, culturally not refined, but irrespective of what is the status of the parents or the family in which one takes birth,
one can be uplifted spiritually by the Pancharatrika system.
This is the method of purification.
After the Garbhadana purificatory process, there are certain other samskaras like Seeman Tonnayana, Sardh Bhakshana, etc.
During the period of pregnancy and when the child is born, the first purificatory process is Jatakarma.
See, before a child is conceived, the very first samskara is called Garbhadana samskara.
Or, the parents combine to conceive a child by themselves purifying their consciousness of material contamination
by observing their child.
By observing certain specific practices.
Now, that is missing in Kali Yuga.
Garbhadana samskara is missing.
They do not even know about it.
That they can have a child with a good background if they are able to perform this Garbhadana samskara.
They themselves become purified before they combine for conceiving a child.
It's not accidental.
It's not by chance some child is born to some parents.
No.

What kind of child you want, accordingly there is a prescription in the scriptures.

were very learned.
